roleset.name: cause contentment; verb frame
roleset.note: CONTENT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'content' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 31.1 (from content.01-v predicate notes)

role.descr: with what, how, if in addition to arg0

example.name: content-v: typical usage
example.text: With talk today of a second economic miracle in West Germany, East Germany no longer can content itself with being the economicstar in a loser league.
example.arg: With talk today of a second economic miracle in West Germany
with being the economic star in a loser league

roleset.name: be content; noun and adjective frame
roleset.note: CONTENT-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on WN eventive noun expansion, content.01, 'satisfaction.01'. Corresponds to VNclsamuse-31.1. (from content.01-n)
CONTENT-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an aliasfile forunification. (from content.01-j)

roles.note: Arg0 expected to be extremely rare-- use arg2 in general.

example.name: content-n: both args
example.text: He seemed to purr his content with the situation.

example.name: content-j: with
example.text: He was content with the situation.

example.name: content-j: from
example.text: as long as he could provide nice things for his wife and live inluxury, he was content.
example.arg: as long as he could provide nice things for his wife and live in luxury
from taking from anyone and everyone.
